Deficiency Narrative: Three of four employee records reviewed did not include reference checks completed prior to employment.
Correction Narrative:
Corrective action received from agency:

This is my formal response to an unannounced inspection that took place on August 4, 2025. The standard 748.7539(a)(1) concerning pre-employment reference checks was cited as a deficiency. A total of 4 employee files were reviewed. Three employees were hired after the standard went into effect. Attached you will find the references letters for the three files that need the reference check. Moving forward HR will send the reference letters for all newly hired employees as well as any employees that were hired after the standard became effective. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Deficiency Narrative: The facility emergency evacuation diagram does not have a shelter in place designation indicated on it.
Correction Narrative: Agency provided amended emergency evacuation plan which now included the shelter in place meeting point.

Deficiency Narrative: An injury requiring medical attention was not reported to until Licensing four days after it occurred.
Correction Narrative:
The operation emailed the following corrective action: 
1.	Each shift will review the serious incident reporting standards found in the licensing minimal standards manual.
2.	All youth will be asked to report any injury right away no matter how small they may think it is. This instruction will also be discussed during the intake process moving forward. 
3.	Staff will be instructed to document any injury or illness and notify myself or the administrator on call within two hours of the situation for instructions to be giving concerning the next steps. 

**During the inspection two staff and one child was interviewed. Each staff confirmed knowledge of the procedure of reporting SIR to licensing. The child reported that she was aware to notify staff if she was injured or ill.**

Deficiency Narrative: After thorough review of the ANE investigation contacts it was determined that a staff did not demonstrate competency, prudent judgment or self-control in a situation with a child in care. It was reported by the staff involved in the incident, victim child, additional children, and a paternal aunt that staff engaged in a verbal dialog with a child that escalated into the staff not choosing the most appropriate way to communicate with the child.
Correction Narrative: The operation reviewed the standard with the staff and discussed ways to communicate appropriately in a stressful situation. The staff was enrolled in a communication training that takes place on 11/4/2024 and will submit the training certificate to Licensing upon worker's completion of the training. The staff participated in role play scenarios to evaluate how the staff would respond and to correct the staff if the response could be perceived as negative.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a staff's file did not have an Licensing Affidavit for the employee.
Correction Narrative: On 6/11/2024, the administrator reviewed all active personnel files. All active personnel files have the required documentation. In the future, the supervisor will check for the Licensing Affidavit for Applicants form on the first day the worker arrives for duty.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found in staff files there was no signed statement stating that they will report any suspected child abuse, neglect, or exploitation
Correction Narrative: On 6/11/2024, all active personnel files were reviewed, and all Abuse and Neglect reporting statements have been updated. Supervisors are required to check files for accuracy. The administrator will review each file at the onset of the onboarding process to ensure this form has been completed.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found during inspection several molded vegetables and expired condiments not fit for consumption.
Correction Narrative: The administrator conducted a walkthrough of the kitchen and assisted the staff in discarding all expired food items. Photos were taken of the discarded items in the trash. A new checklist was implemented for staff to make daily checks of all areas containing food. A copy of the checklist was provided to Licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that one vehicle that transports children had an expired registration.
Correction Narrative: On 6/10/2024, facilities took the vehicle to get the inspection and registration. The vehicle inspection and registration receipt were provided to Licensing.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a staff did not have an reference from their previous employee in their employee file.
Correction Narrative: On 6/11/2024 the administrator reviewed all active personnel files. The documents were requested form HR, and all active personnel files have the required documentation.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that the staff list had employees that were no longer working at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The staff list has been corrected prior to Licensing exiting the building.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that their indication of any known allergies or chronic conditions on the exterior of the child's file.
Correction Narrative: On 6/10/2024, all active youth files were reviewed for the allergy and chronic condition form. All forms have been placed in the appropriate area of the file.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that there were broken toilet lids in children's bathrooms.
Correction Narrative: On 6/10/2024, a maintenance request was placed, and the toilets were both replaced. The receipt for the replacements was provided to Licensing. The new toilets have been installed.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that staff files did not have the applicant's 5 year employment history.
Correction Narrative: On 6/11/2024, the administrator reviewed all active personnel files. The necessary documents were requested from HR, and all active personnel files have the required information.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the review of the investigation it was determined that a staff member left children in care with unqualified caregivers while escorting a child to the clinic.
Correction Narrative: Based on the review of the investigation it was determined that a staff member left children in care with unqualified caregivers while escorting a child to the clinic.

Deficiency Narrative: Licensing observed three staff files with no documentation of six month emergency behavior intervention training (CPI).
Correction Narrative: Up to date training certifications were provided via email by the operation.

Deficiency Narrative:
Van 30636 has a tire pressure indicator on. 
Van 31238  does not have operable A/C for rows 2-5.
Correction Narrative: Operation emailed service receipt for tire pressure check for both vehicles. Operation emailed that a/c was turned on for vehicle.

Deficiency Narrative: 3 of 3 vans had fire extinguishers that were out of compliance.
2 of 3 vans had service lights on, requiring maintenance service for an oil change and low tire pressure.
A child's Medication Record does not list the amount of medication administered.
Correction Narrative: Operation emailed a copy of medication log and stated that they have talked to staff members who administer medication to ensure that they are filling out the form in its entirety to include the dosage amount provided to children in care. The operation reported to have added another layer of documentation onto the form having staff document the dosage given.

Deficiency Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

4 of 5 staff stated that the child was allowed to a razor before shower time. Staff stated that they knew the child had self harm behavior in her past. 2 of 2 children stated that the child was allowed to have her razor before shower time.
Correction Narrative: Kinder Shelter has changed its procedures regarding  razor during shower time . Youth with current History of Self  harm will be provided with Nair hair removal during shower time to prevent cutting.
